metadata.title: TS/RDS - Time Limit for Disc. Session
metadata.description: Remote Desktop Services is configured to set a time limit for disconnected sessions

criterion.comment: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services!MaxDisconnectionTime value is less than or equal to 60000
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services!MaxDisconnectionTime value is greater than 0

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Time Limit for Idle Session
metadata.description: Remote Desktop Services is configured to allow an idle session limit no greater than 15 minutes

criterion.comment: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services!MaxIdleTime value is less than or equal to 900000
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services!MaxIdleTime value is greater than 0

metadata.title: Configure Microsoft SpyNet Reporting
metadata.description: When Windows Defender detects software or changes by software not yet classified for risks, you see how other members responded to the alert. In turn, the action you apply help other members choose how to respond. Your actions also help Microsoft choose which software to investigate for potential threats. You can choose to send basic or additional information about detected software. Additional information helps improve how Windows Defender works. It can include, for example, the location of detected items on your computer if harmful software has been removed. Windows Defender will automatically collect and send the information.

metadata.title: Disable Logging
metadata.description: If this setting is enabled Windows Error Reporting events will not be logged to the system event log.

metadata.title: Disable Windows Error Reporting
metadata.description: If this setting is enabled, Windows Error Reporting will not send any problem information to Microsoft. Additionally, solution information will not be available in the Problem Reports and Solutions control panel.

metadata.title: Do Not Send Additional Data
metadata.description: If this setting is enabled any additional data requests from Microsoft in response to a Windows Error Reporting event will be automatically declined without notice to the user.

metadata.title: Turn off Data Execution Protection
metadata.description: Turn off Data Execution Protection

metadata.title: Turn off Heap termination on corruption
metadata.description: Turn off Heap termination on corruption

metadata.title: Turn off shell protocol protected mode
metadata.description: Turn off shell protocol protected mode

metadata.title: Disable IE security prompt for Windows Installer scripts
metadata.description: Disable IE security prompt for Windows Installer scripts

metadata.title: Enable user control over installs
metadata.description: Permits users to change installation options that typically are available only to system administrators. This setting bypasses some of the security features of Windows Installer.

metadata.title: Prohibit non-administrators from applying vendor signed updates
metadata.description: This setting controls the ability of non-administrators to install updates that have been digitally signed by the application vendor.

metadata.title: Prohibit non-administrators from applying vendor signed updates
metadata.description: This setting controls the ability of non-administrators to install updates that have been digitally signed by the application vendor.

metadata.title: Prevent Windows Media DRM Internet Access
metadata.description: Prevents Windows Media Digital Rights Management (DRM) from accessing the Internet (or intranet). When enabled, Windows Media DRM is prevented from accessing the Internet (or intranet) for license acquisition and security upgrades.

metadata.title: Do Not Show First Use Dialog Boxes
metadata.description: Do Not Show First Use Dialog Boxes This policy prevents the Privacy Options and Installation Options dialog boxes from being displayed the first time a user starts Windows Media Player. This policy prevents the dialog boxes which allow users to select privacy, file types, and other desktop options from being displayed when the Player is first started. Some of the options can be configured by using other Windows Media Player group policies. When this policy is not configured or disabled, the dialog boxes are displayed when the user starts the Player for the first time.

metadata.title: Media Player - Disable Automatic Updates
metadata.description: Media Player is configured to allow automatic checking for updates

metadata.title: Configure automatic updates
metadata.description: Configure automatic updates

metadata.title: Audit Other Account Management Events on Success
metadata.description: Verify that the success audit setting for 'Audit Other Account Management Events' has been set appropriately.

criterion.comment: Audit event subcategories policy for Other Account Management Events equals AUDIT_SUCCESS
Audit event subcategories policy for Other Account Management Events equals AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE

metadata.title: Audit Process Creation on Success
metadata.description: Verify that the success audit setting for 'Audit Process Creation' has been set appropriately.

criterion.comment: Audit event subcategories policy for Process Creation equals AUDIT_SUCCESS
Audit event subcategories policy for Process Creation equals AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE

metadata.title: Audit Registry on Failure
metadata.description: Verify that the failure audit setting for 'Audit Registry' has been set appropriately.

criterion.comment: Audit event subcategories policy for Registry equals AUDIT_FAILURE
Audit event subcategories policy for Registry equals AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE

metadata.title: Audit Security Group Management on Success

criterion.comment: Audit event subcategories policy for Security Group Management equals AUDIT_SUCCESS

criterion.comment: Audit event subcategories policy for Security State Change equals AUDIT_SUCCESS
Audit event subcategories policy for Security State Change equals AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE

metadata.title: Audit Security System Extension on Success

metadata.title: Administrator Account Status
metadata.description: This definition verifies that the Administrator account is enabled/disabled based on the policy defined by the user.

metadata.title: Microsoft network server: Server SPN target name validation level
metadata.description: This policy setting controls the level of validation a computer with shared folders or printers (the server) performs on the service principal name (SPN) that is provided by the client computer when it establishes a session using the server message block (SMB) protocol.

metadata.title: MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting IPv6) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)
metadata.description: Allowing source routed network traffic allows attackers to obscure their identity and location.

metadata.title: MSS: (Hidden) Hide computer from the browse list (Not Recommended except for highly secure environments
metadata.description: Hiding the computer from the Browse List removes one method attackers might use to gether information about computers on the network.

metadata.title: MSS: (TcpMaxDataRetransmissions IPv6) How many times unacknowledged data is retransmitted (3 recommended, 5 is default).
metadata.description: MSS: (TcpMaxDataRetransmissions IPv6) How many times unacknowledged data is retransmitted (3 recommended, 5 is default).

criterion.comment: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip6\Parameters!TcpMaxDataRetransmissions value is less than or equal to variable

metadata.title: Network security: Allow Local System to use computer identity for NTLM
metadata.description: This policy setting allows services running as Local System to use the computer identity when negotiating NTLM authentication.

metadata.title: Network security: Allow LocalSystem NULL session fallback
metadata.description: This policy setting allows the system to fall back no a NULL session.

metadata.title: Network Security: Allow PKU2U authentication requests to this computer to use online identities
metadata.description: Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2 introduce an extension to the Negotiate authentication package, Spnego.dll. In previous versions of Windows, Negotiate decides whether to use Kerberos or NTLM for authentication. The extension SSP for Negotiate, Negoexts, which is treated as an authentication protocol by Windows, supports Microsoft SSPs including PKU2U.

metadata.title: Network Security: Configure encryption types allowed for Kerberos
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to specify the allowed encryption types for Kerberos authentication.

metadata.title: Log Dropped Packets
metadata.description: The "Log Dropped Packets" option for the Windows Firewall should be configured correctly for the Domain Profile.

metadata.title: Logged Successful Connections
metadata.description: The "Log Successful Connections" option for the Windows Firewall should be configured correctly for the Domain Profile.

metadata.title: Windows Firewall Log File Path and Name (Domain Profile)
metadata.description: The log file path and name for the Windows Firewall should be configured correctly for the Domain Profile.

metadata.title: Size Limit
metadata.description: The log file size limit for the Windows Firewall should be configured correctly for the Domain Profile.

criterion.comment: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsFirewall\DomainProfile\Logging!LogFileSize value is greater than or equal to variable

metadata.description: No one is allowed to logon to the computer using Remote Desktop Services

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services!MaxIdleTime value is less than or equal to 900000
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\EventLog\Application!MaxSize value equals or is greater than variable

external_variable.comment: Maximum Application Log Size
Maximum Setup Log Size
MSS: (NoDefaultExempt) Configure IPSec exemptions for various types of network traffic
Always prompt for password upon connection
Set client connection encryption level
Prohibit installation and configuration of Network Bridge on your DNS domain network
Do not delete temp folder upon exit
MSS: (NoNameReleaseOnDemand) Allow computer to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers
Do not allow drive redirection
Turn off Automatic Root Certificates Update
Maximum Password Age
Minimum Password Age
Enforce Password Complexity
Enforce Reversible Encryption When Storing Passwords
Minimum Password Length
Account Lockout Threshold
Reset Account Lockout Counter After
Status of Guest Account
Accounts: Limit local account use to blank passwords to console logon only
Audit: Audit the access of global system objects
Audit: Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege
Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings (Windows Vista or later) to override audit policy category settings
Prevent Users From Installing Printer Drivers
Restrict Access to CDROM Drive
Do not use temporary folders per session
Domain member: Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible)
Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always)
Domain member: Digitally sign secure channel data (when possible)
Domain member: Disable machine account password changes
Maximum Machine Account Password Age
Require Strong Session Key
Interactive logon: Do not display last user name
Interactive logon: Do not require CTRL+ALT+DEL
Number of Previous Logons to Cache (in Case Domain Controller Is Not Available)
Prompt User to Change Password Before Expiration
Require Domain Controller Authentication to Unlock Workstation
Smart Card Removal Behavior
Client Digitally Sign Communications (Always)
Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (if server agrees)
Microsoft network client: Send unencrypted password to third-party SMB servers
Amount of Idle Time Required Before Suspending Session
Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (always)
Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (if client agrees)
Microsoft network server: Disconnect clients when logon hours expire
MSS: (AutoAdminLogon) Enable Automatic Logon (Not Recommended)
MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)
Allow users to connect remotely using Remote Desktop Services
MSS: (EnableICMPRedirect) Allow ICMP redirects to override OSPF generated routes
MSS: (KeepAliveTime)How often keep-alive packets are sent in milliseconds
Audit: Shut down system immediately if unable to log security audits
Turn off Windows Update device driver search prompt
MSS: (PerformRouterDiscovery) Allow IRDP to detect and configure DefaultGateway addresses (could lead to DoS)
MSS: (SafeDllSearchMode) Enable Safe DLL search mode (recommended)
MSS: (ScreenSaverGracePeriod) The time in seconds before the screen saver grace period expires (0 recommended)
MSS: (TCPMaxDataRetransmissions) How many times unacknowledged data is retransmitted (3 recommended, 5 is default)
MSS: (WarningLevel) Percentage threshold for the security event log at which the system will generate a warning

Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts and shares
Network access: Do not allow storage of credentials or .NET Passports for network authentication

Network Security: LDAP client signing requirements

Recovery Console: Allow Floppy Copy and Access to All Drives and All Folders
Shutdown: Allow System to be Shut Down Without Having to Log On
Shutdown: Clear Virtual Memory Pagefile

System objects: Require case insensitivity for non-Windows subsystems
System objects: Strengthen default permissions of internal system objects

Disable Windows Error Reporting
Do Not Send Additional Data

Turn off shell protocol protected mode

Enable user control over installs
Prohibit non-administrators from applying vendor signed updates
Do Not Show First Use Dialog Boxes
Devices: Allow only administrators to format and eject removable media
MSS: (NtfsDisable8dot3NameCreation) Enable the computer to stop generating 8.3 style filenames (recommended) (Disabled = 0)
